question: My doc first thought I had Cushings, but the test came back NOT (could have pseudo Cushings), but now they found calcium levels are high and are going after hyperparathyroid--but I have insistent Type 2 diabetes now, high BP, high Trigylicerides, High cholesterol...is this a package that can emanate from hyperparathryoid?  What a pain this is because I'm trapped in medical model that is dysfunctional--a resident internist.  They told me yesterday after having tests STAT that I'd have to wait for a doctor's appointment in mid-July.  NOT.  I'm climb all the way to the top!  (irritability?  NO...but a demand for good medicine...never been a sheep!)  Can anyone reflect on diabetes as it related to thyroid disorders?  Can't seem to get answers!
title: Cluster of Problems with Hyperparathyroid?
